title: Manchester United captain Katie Zelem seeking revenge over City in second derby
text:
Manchester United captain Katie Zelem has waited her whole life for a women’s Manchester derby, and now two have come along in six weeks.

After the first one, held at the Etihad in front of a league record of 31,000 fans, United and City meet again on Sunday in the Continental League Cup.

Zelem cannot quite believe her side, newly promoted into the Women’s Super League, have played the first derby, never mind the second coming up.

“It’s incredible,” said Zelem. “When I was little, I didn’t even think they’d have a first team, let alone walking out at the Etihad in front of 30,000 people.”

The Zelem family are United through and through, and they play a huge part in her football career. “My dad will come to every game possible, home and away. After every game, I’ll go straight to my mum and dad.”
description: Manchester United captain Katie Zelem has waited her whole life for a women’s Manchester derby, and now two have come along in six weeks.
